DOC.brief_title: Role Antioxidants Unexplained Oligohydramnios , A Randomized Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Type study : This prospective randomized control study do department obstetrics gynecology Assiut University Hospital . Aim work : 1 . To study effect antioxidant case oligohydramnios . 2 . To study effect antioxidant mode delivery neonatal outcome . 3 . To commence special recommendation study use antioxidant case oligohydramnios unknown cause case oligohydramnios associate pregnancy induce hypertension . Inclusion criterion : Patients gestational age 30-34 week : - Oligohydramnios unknown cause . - Oligohydramnios assosiatd Pregnancy induce hypertension ( PIH ) . Exclusion criterion : 1 . Premature rupture membrane . 2 . Oligohydramnios postdates pregnancy ( > 41 week ) . 3 . Fetal anomaly . 4 . IUGR . 5 . Patients use non steroidal anti-inflammatory drug . Assessment patient : The target population assess find participate woman suitable study , assessment do verify inclusion criterion exclude woman exclusion criterion . Ultrasongraphic evaluation : Ultrasongraphy do estimation amniotic fluid index measure vertical diameter pocket amniotic fluid four section uterus add together . This give number know amniotic fluid index ( AFI ) . If AFI le 5 centimeter , pregnant woman oligohydramnios Composition omega-3 plus : Soft gelatineous capsule ( Sedico medical company ) capsule contains : - Fish oil ( 30 ) % ( Eicosapentaenoic acid ( EPA ) 18 % / Docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) 12 % ) natural source Omega 3 Fatty acid . - Wheat germ oil ( Tocopherol : N.N.T . 0.22 % ) rich natural source Vitamin E ( protect oil oxidation . besides well know requirement vitamin E increase increase dietary amount polyunsaturated fatty acid ) .
DOC.criteria: Patients gestational age 3034 week : Oligohydramnios unknown cause . 1 Premature rupture membrane . 2 Oligohydramnios postdates pregnancy ( > 41 week ) . 3 Fetal anomaly . 4 IUGR . 5 Patients use non steroidal antiinflammatory drug . 6 Oligohydramnios assosiatd Pregnancy induce hypertension ( PIH ) .
